9 Do n't jump yet . 
25 The stock market ' s swoon may turn out to be good news for the economy . 
98 In <TIMEX TYPE="TIME">one wild hour </TIMEX>of trading , the market managed to accomplish what the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Bush </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>has been trying to do , unsuccessfully , for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">weeks </TIMEX>. 
239 It is forcing the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Federal Reserve </ENAMEX>to ease its grip on credit and it took the wind out of a previously irrepressible dollar . 
363 The resulting decline in interest rates and the value of the dollar could reinvigorate <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">American </ENAMEX>business - - indeed , the entire economy . 
501 This may sound strangely optimistic . 
538 After all , until <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">a few years ago </TIMEX>, the stock market was viewed as a barometer of the national economy . 
640 When it went down , by all tradition , the economy followed . 
701 That has changed , partly because the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">two years </TIMEX>following the worst stock - market plunge in history have been reasonably comfortable . 
833 The <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash was ` a false alarm however you view it , ' says <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:EDUCATIONAL">University of Chicago </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economist </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Victor Zarnowitz </ENAMEX>. 
946 The market seems increasingly disconnected from the rest of the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">nation </ENAMEX>. 
1018 Its spasms ca n't be traced to fundamental business conditions , nor do they appear to presage major shifts in the economy . 
1140 ` The market <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>has a life of its own , ' <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">John Akers </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">chairman </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">International Business Machines Corp . </ENAMEX>, said <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Saturday </TIMEX>. 
1260 ` There ' s nothing rational about this kind of action . ' 
1316 Of course , the health of the economy will be threatened if the market continues to dive <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">this week </TIMEX>. 
1415 Sharply falling stock prices do reduce consumer wealth , damage business confidence and discourage the foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>upon whom the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>now relies for financial sustenance . 
1591 The financial - services industry was battered by the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash . 
1655 What ' s more , although the stock market is far less overvalued <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>than <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">two years ago </TIMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>economy is weaker . 
1771 Growth is slower . 
1789 Profits are softer . 
1809 Debt burdens are heavier . 
1837 But if the stock market does n't continue to plummet , the beneficial effects of lower interest rates and a lower dollar may well dominate . 
1975 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>, which until <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>had been resisting moves to ease credit , is now poised to pour money into the economy if needed to soothe the markets . 
2122 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>may protest that this does n't necessarily mean a fundamental change in their interest - rate policies . 
2237 But the experience of the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash suggests the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>is likely to bring down short - term interest rates in its effort to calm markets . 
2374 Anticipating the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>' s move , money <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">traders </ENAMEX>lowered a key interest rate known as the Federal Funds rate to <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">8 . 625 % </NUMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">late Friday </TIMEX>, down from <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">8 . 820 % </NUMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the day </TIMEX>before . 
2533 Tiny movements in the rate , which is what <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">banks </ENAMEX>charge each other for overnight loans , are usually among the few visible tracks that the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>leaves on the monetary markets . 
2708 The dollar also began to decline <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>as the stock market ' s plunge caused some <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>to reassess their desire to invest in the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S .  </ENAMEX>
2846 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Treasury </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>have been arguing for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">months </TIMEX>that the dollar ' s strength was out of whack with economic fundamentals , threatening to extinguish the export boom that has sustained <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">manufacturers </ENAMEX>for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">several years </TIMEX>. 
3060 The market drop has now apparently convinced foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>that the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Treasury </ENAMEX>was right about the overpriced dollar . 
3182 A modest drop in the dollar - - only a modest one , mind you - - would be welcomed by the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S .  </ENAMEX>
3274 That was n't the case in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>, when the dollar was so weak that some <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economists </ENAMEX>and government <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>seriously worried that it might collapse , producing panic among foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>and diminishing the flow of foreign capital to the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S .  </ENAMEX>
3518 Another big difference between <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>and <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1989 </TIMEX>is n't so comforting . 
3584 In <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the third quarter of 1987 </TIMEX>, the economy spurted at an inflation - adjusted <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:OTHER">annual </TIMEX>rate of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">5 . 3 % </NUMEX>. 
3680 The consensus among <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economists </ENAMEX>is that it grew a much more sluggish <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">2 . 3 % </NUMEX>in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the third quarter of 1989 </TIMEX>, which ended <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">two weeks ago </TIMEX>. 
3812 The plunge in stock prices ` is happening at a time when the economy has already slowed down , ' says <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economist </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lawrence Chimerine </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:OTHER">WEFA Group </ENAMEX>, a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Bala Cynwyd </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Pa . </ENAMEX>, forecasting <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>. 
3996 ` A lot of pent - up demand is gone . ' 
4033 Consumer spending did drop in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the months </TIMEX>following <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">Black Monday </ENAMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>- - ` but only slightly and for a short period of time , ' recalls Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Zarnowitz </ENAMEX>, a longtime <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">student </ENAMEX>of business cycles . 
4219 ` That was offset by strength elsewhere . 
4259 -LCB- The effects -RCB- were much less severe and less prolonged than some had feared or expected . ' 
4349 Today , he frets , exports and business investment spending may be insufficient to pick up the slack if stock prices sink <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">this week </TIMEX>and if <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">consumers </ENAMEX>retrench in reaction . 
4520 What ' s more , the corporate borrowing binge has n't abated in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the past two years </TIMEX>. 
4600 ` We ' ve had <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">two more years </TIMEX>of significant accumulation of debt . . . just at the time when earnings are being squeezed , ' Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Chimerine </ENAMEX>notes . 
4741 The more a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>relies on borrowed money , the greater its sensitivity to an economic slowdown . 
4839 A <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>with a strong balance sheet can withstand an unanticipated storm ; a highly leveraged <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>may end up in bankruptcy <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">court </ENAMEX>. 
4976 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>, of course , knows that very well - - hence its readiness to pump credit into the economy <TIMEX TYPE="TIME">this morning </TIMEX>. 
5086 But , in the process , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>risks reigniting inflation . 
5143 Even before <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s events , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:EDUCATIONAL">Harvard University </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economist </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Benjamin Friedman </ENAMEX>was arguing that the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>wo n't be able to live up to its tough words on eliminating inflation because of its responsibility to protect fragile financial markets , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">banks </ENAMEX>and highly leveraged <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">corporations </ENAMEX>. 
5422 The biggest threat on the economic horizon right now is n't recession , he reasons ; it ' s an outbreak of uncontrolled inflation . 
5550 In the end , the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>collapse suggested , the economy does n't move in lockstep with stock prices . 
5647 The economy does , however , depend on the confidence of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">businesses </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">consumers </ENAMEX>and foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>. 
5747 A panic on Wall Street does n't exactly inspire confidence . 
5808 Surveys suggested that consumer confidence was high before <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>. 
5875 A <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">190 </NUMEX>- point drop is n't likely to make much of a dent ; multiply that a few times over , though , and it will . 
5982 If the reactions of <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">executives </ENAMEX>gathered <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Saturday </TIMEX>at <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hot Springs </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Va . </ENAMEX>, for the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:OTHER">Business Council </ENAMEX>meetings are typical , business <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">leaders </ENAMEX>were n't overly rattled by <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s decline . 
6160 And if foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>become a tad more cautious - - well , the dollar ' s recent strength suggests that the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>can stand it . 
6289 On the bottom line , the most comforting fact for the economic outlook is that we ' ve been through this before . 
6399 <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Two years ago </TIMEX>, about the only point of comparison was the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1929 </TIMEX>crash and the subsequent <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">Depression </ENAMEX>. 
6499 The <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">doomsayers </ENAMEX>had a receptive <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">audience </ENAMEX>. 
6540 The prosperity that followed <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">Black Monday </ENAMEX>permits a more optimistic view <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>. 
6622 At the very least , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:OTHER">establishment </ENAMEX>here is taking comfort from the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">nation </ENAMEX>' s success in handling the last go - around . 
6740 As <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Sen . </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lloyd Bentsen </ENAMEX>-LRB- <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:POLITICAL">D . </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Texas </ENAMEX>-RRB- observed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">yesterday </TIMEX>, ` The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Fed </ENAMEX>avoided a meltdown last time . 
6833 They are more sophisticated this time .  

9 <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Walter Sisulu </ENAMEX>and the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">African National Congress </ENAMEX>came home <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">yesterday </TIMEX>. 
80 After <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">26 years </TIMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">prison </ENAMEX>, Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Sisulu </ENAMEX>, the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:AGE">77 - year - old </TIMEX>former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">secretary - general </ENAMEX>of the liberation movement , was dropped off at his <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">house </ENAMEX>by a prison <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">services </ENAMEX>' <ENAMEX TYPE="PRODUCT_DESC:VEHICLE">van </ENAMEX>just as the sun was coming up . 
273 At the same time , <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">six </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">colleagues </ENAMEX>, <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">five </NUMEX>of whom were arrested with him in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1963 </TIMEX>and sentenced to life imprisonment , were reunited with their <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">families </ENAMEX>at various places around the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">country </ENAMEX>. 
465 And as the graying <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">men </ENAMEX>returned to their <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">homes </ENAMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>, outlawed in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">South Africa </ENAMEX>since <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1960 </TIMEX>and still considered to be the chief public <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">enemy </ENAMEX>by the white <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>, defiantly returned to the <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:HIGHWAY_STREET">streets </ENAMEX>of the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">country </ENAMEX>' s black <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:CITY">townships </ENAMEX>.

914 At the small <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">four </NUMEX>- room <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">home </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Elias Motsoaledi </ENAMEX>, a leading <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">unionist </ENAMEX>and a former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">commander </ENAMEX>in the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">group </ENAMEX>' s armed <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">wing </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Umkhonto we Sizwe </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">well - wishers </ENAMEX>stuck little <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>flags in their hair and a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">man </ENAMEX>tooted on an antelope horn wrapped in <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>ribbons . 
1168 ` I am happy to see the spirit of the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>, ' said Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Sisulu </ENAMEX>, looking dapper in a new gray suit . 
1266 As the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">crowd </ENAMEX>outside his <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">home </ENAMEX>shouted ` <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>, ' the old <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">man </ENAMEX>shot his fists into the air . 
1357 ` I ' m inspired by the mood of the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>. ' 
1401 Under the laws of the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">land </ENAMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>remains an illegal <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">organization </ENAMEX>, and its <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">headquarters </ENAMEX>are still in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Lusaka </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Zambia </ENAMEX>.

2635 <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">President </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">F . W . de Klerk </ENAMEX>released the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">men </ENAMEX>- - along with <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>of the founding <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">members </ENAMEX>of the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Pan Africanist Congress </ENAMEX>, a rival liberation <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">group </ENAMEX>- - as part of his efforts to create a climate of trust and peace in which his <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>can begin negotiations with black <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">leaders </ENAMEX>over a new constitution aimed at giving <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">blacks </ENAMEX>a voice in national <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>. 
2991 But <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Pretoria </ENAMEX>may instead be creating a climate for more turmoil and uncertainty in this racially divided <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">country </ENAMEX>. 
3105 As other repressive <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">governments </ENAMEX>, particularly <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Poland </ENAMEX>and the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Soviet Union </ENAMEX>, have recently discovered , initial steps to open up society can create a momentum for radical change that becomes difficult , if not impossible , to control . 
3337 As <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the days </TIMEX>go by , the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">South African </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>will be ever more hard pressed to justify the continued imprisonment of Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mandela </ENAMEX>as well as the continued banning of the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">ANC </ENAMEX>and enforcement of the state of emergency .

9 <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>' s second bout of general elections <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">this year </TIMEX>is slated for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Nov . 5 </TIMEX>. 
83 For those hoping to see a modicum of political normalcy restored - - in view of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>' s <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">eight - year </TIMEX>misadventure under autocratic pseudosocialism and subsequent <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">three - month </TIMEX>hitch with a conservative - communist coalition <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>- - there is but <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>bright sign : The scandals still encircling former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Prime Minister </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Andreas Papandreou </ENAMEX>and his fallen socialist <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>are like <ENAMEX TYPE="ANIMAL">flies </ENAMEX>buzzing around a rotting carcass . 
503 In the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">mid - June </TIMEX>round of voting , <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greeks </ENAMEX>gave no clear mandate to any single political <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">party </ENAMEX>. 
596 The ad interim coalition <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>that emerged from post - electoral hagglings was , in essence , little more than the ill - conceived offspring of ideological miscegenation : On <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>side , the center - right <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">New Democracy Party </ENAMEX>, headed by <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Constantine Mitsotakis </ENAMEX>. 
852 On the other , the so - called <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Coalition of the Left and Progress </ENAMEX>- - a quaint and rather deceptive title for a merger of the pro - <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Soviet </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Communist Party </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>and its <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Euro </ENAMEX>- <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:POLITICAL">Communist </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">cousin </ENAMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Hellenic Left </ENAMEX>. 
1063 The unifying bond for this left - right mismatch was plain : <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>-LRB- Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">party </ENAMEX>-RRB- as common political <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">enemy </ENAMEX>. 
1179 The ostensible goal was a mop - up of government corruption , purportedly at all levels , but the main marks were Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>and his closest <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">associates </ENAMEX>. 
1332 In point of fact , this catharsis was overdue by <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">decades </TIMEX>. 
1389 When reduced to buzzword status in ex parte pledges , however , the notion transmogrified into a promised assault , with targets primarily for political gains , not justice . 
1561 With regard to <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>' s long - bubbling bank - looting scandal , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>' s principal <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">accuser </ENAMEX>remains <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">George Koskotas </ENAMEX>, former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">owner </ENAMEX>of the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Bank of Crete </ENAMEX>and self - confessed <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">embezzler </ENAMEX>, now residing in a jail <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">cell </ENAMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Salem </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Mass . </ENAMEX>, from where he is fighting extradition proceedings that would return him to <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>. 
1873 Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Koskotas </ENAMEX>' s credibility is , at best , problematic . 
1926 He has ample motive to shift the blame , and his testimony has also been found less than forthright on numerous points . 
2045 Nevertheless , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">New Democracy </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:POLITICAL">Communist </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">parties </ENAMEX>herald his assertions as proof of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>complicity . 
2153 Among unanswered questions are whether Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>received <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 23 million </NUMEX>of stolen <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Bank of Crete </ENAMEX>funds and an additional <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 734 , 000 </NUMEX>in bribes , as contended ; whether the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">prime minister </ENAMEX>ordered state <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">agencies </ENAMEX>to deposit <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">some $ 57 million </NUMEX>in Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Koskotas </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">bank </ENAMEX>and then skim off the interest ; and , what <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>' s cut was from the <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 210 million </NUMEX>Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Koskotas </ENAMEX>pinched . 
2515 <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">Two </NUMEX>former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">ministers </ENAMEX>were so heavily implicated in the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Koskotas </ENAMEX>affair that <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">members </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Parliament </ENAMEX>voted to refer them to the special <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">court </ENAMEX>. 
2661 But eluding parliamentary probe was the case of <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">millions of drachmas </NUMEX>Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Koskotas </ENAMEX>funneled into <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">New Democracy </ENAMEX>coffers . 
2780 In the end , the investigation produced only circumstantial evidence and ` indications ' that point to <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>, not clinching proof . 
2910 On another issue , <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greeks </ENAMEX>were told how their national intelligence <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">agency </ENAMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">EYP </ENAMEX>, regularly monitored the telephone conversations of prominent <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">figures </ENAMEX>, including key opposition <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">politicians </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">journalists </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>cabinet <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">members </ENAMEX>. 
3141 Despite convincing arguments , it was never established that Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>personally ordered or directed the wiretaps . 
3263 The central weakness of the ` scandals ' debates was pointed up especially well when discussions focused on arms deals and kickbacks . 
3395 The coalition <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>tried to show that <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">ministers </ENAMEX>had received hefty sums for OKing the purchase of <ENAMEX TYPE="PRODUCT:VEHICLE">F - 16 Fighting Falcon </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PRODUCT:VEHICLE">Mirage 2000 </ENAMEX>combat <ENAMEX TYPE="PRODUCT_DESC:VEHICLE">aircraft </ENAMEX>, produced by the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">General Dynamics Corp . </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">France </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Avions Marcel Dassault </ENAMEX>, respectively . 
3659 Naturally , neither <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">General Dynamics </ENAMEX>nor <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Dassault </ENAMEX>could be expected to hamper its prospective future dealings by making disclosures of sums paid -LRB- or not -RRB- to various <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greek </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>for services rendered . 
3864 So it seems that Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mitsotakis </ENAMEX>and his communist <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">chums </ENAMEX>may have unwittingly served Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>a moral victory on a platter : <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>, whether guilty or not , can now traipse the countryside condemning the whole affair as a witch hunt at Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>' s expense . 
4128 But while verbal high jinks alone wo n't help <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>regain power , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>should never be underestimated . 
4240 <NUMEX TYPE="ORDINAL">First </NUMEX>came his predictable fusillade : He charged the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Coalition of the Left </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Progress </ENAMEX>had sold out its leftist tenets by collaborating in a right - wing plot aimed at ousting <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>and thwarting the course of socialism in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>. 
4472 Then , to buttress his credibility with the left , he enticed some smaller leftist <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">parties </ENAMEX>to stand for election under the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>banner . 
4607 Next , he continued to court the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">communists </ENAMEX>- - many of whom feel betrayed by the left - right <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">coalition </ENAMEX>' s birth - - by bringing into <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>a well - respected <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">Communist Party </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">candidate </ENAMEX>. 
4786 For balance , and in hopes of gaining some disaffected centrist votes , he managed to attract a former <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">New Democracy Party </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">representative </ENAMEX>and known political enemy of Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mitsotakis </ENAMEX>. 
4967 Thus <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>heads for the polls not only with diminished scandal - stench , but also with ` seals of approval ' from <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">representatives </ENAMEX>of its harshest <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">accusers </ENAMEX>. 
5122 Crucial as these elections are for <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>, pressing issues of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">state </ENAMEX>are getting lost in the shuffle . 
5223 The <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">country </ENAMEX>' s future <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">NATO </ENAMEX>participation remains unsure , for instance . 
5293 <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>also must revamp major pieces of legislation in preparation for the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1992 </TIMEX>targets of heightened Common Market cooperation . 
5422 <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>' s bilateral relations with the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>need attention soon as well . 
5494 For <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>, the current accord concerning <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>military <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:OTHER">bases </ENAMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>lapses in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">May 1990 </TIMEX>. 
5583 Negotiations for a new agreement were frozen before the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">June </TIMEX>elections , but the clock is running . 
5683 Another matter of concern is the extradition of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mohammed Rashid </ENAMEX>, a <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Palestinian </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">terrorist </ENAMEX>who is wanted in the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . 5853 The <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greek </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">courts </ENAMEX>have decided in favor of extradition in the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Rashid </ENAMEX>case , but the matter awaits final approval from <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>' s next justice <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">minister </ENAMEX>. 
6001 The <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greeks </ENAMEX>seem barely aware of the importance of the case as a litmus test of whether <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Greece </ENAMEX>will be counted in or out for international efforts to combat terrorism . 
6170 That <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>could win the elections outright is improbable ; the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Greek </ENAMEX>press , previously eager to palm off <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>' s line , has turned on Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>with a wild - eyed vengeance . 
6346 Yet the possibility of another lash - up <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">government </ENAMEX>is all too real . 
6413 If Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>becomes the major opposition <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">leader </ENAMEX>, he could hamstring a conservative - led <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:POLITICAL">coalition </ENAMEX>. 
6517 Also , he could force new elections <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">early next year </TIMEX>by frustrating the procedures for the election of the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">president </ENAMEX>of the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">republic </ENAMEX>in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">March </TIMEX>. 
6660 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">New Democracy </ENAMEX>has once again glaringly underestimated the opponent and linked its own <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">prospects </ENAMEX>to negative reaction against <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:POLITICAL">PASOK </ENAMEX>, forgetting to tend to either program clarity or the rectification of internal squabbles . 
6883 As for Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Papandreou </ENAMEX>? 
6906 He ' s not exactly sitting pretty at this stage . 
6953 But since he is undoubtedly one of the most proficient bull <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">slingers </ENAMEX>who ever raked muck , it seems far wiser to view him as sidelined , but certainly not yet eliminated .

9 <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Mexican </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investor </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Joel Rocha Garza </ENAMEX>said he sold a block of <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">600 , 000 </NUMEX>shares of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Smith Laboratories Inc . </ENAMEX>common stock to <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>affiliated with him .

9 Put down that phone . 
32 Walk around the <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">room </ENAMEX>; take two deep breaths . 
77 Resist the urge to call your <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">broker </ENAMEX>and sell all your stocks . 
141 That ' s the advice of most investment <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">professionals </ENAMEX>after <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">190 </NUMEX>- point drop in the Dow Jones Industrial Average . 
261 No one can say for sure what will happen <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>. 
309 And investment pros are divided on whether stocks will perform well or badly in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the next six months </TIMEX>. 
410 But they ' re nearly unanimous on <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>point : Do n't sell into a panic . 
480 <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Investors </ENAMEX>who sold everything after the crash of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>lived to regret it . 
554 Even after <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s plunge , the Dow Jones Industrial Average was <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">48 % </NUMEX>above where it landed on <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Oct . 19 two years ago </TIMEX>. 
673 Panic selling also was unwise during other big declines in the past . 
742 The <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">crash of 1929 </ENAMEX>was followed by a substantial recovery before the <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">great Depression </ENAMEX>and awful bear market of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the 1930s </TIMEX>began . 
869 The ` <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">October </TIMEX>massacres ' of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1978 </TIMEX>and <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1979 </TIMEX>were scary , but did n't lead to severe or sustained downturns . 
974 Indeed , some <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">pros </ENAMEX>see <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s plunge , plus any further damage that might occur <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">early this week </TIMEX>, as a chance for bargain hunting .

Timbers </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">chief investment officer </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Chicago </ENAMEX>- based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Kemper Financial Services Inc .

' 
1575 Even for <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>who expect a bear market in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">coming months </TIMEX>- - and a sizable number of money <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">managers </ENAMEX>and market <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">pundits </ENAMEX>do - - the advice is : Wait for the market to bounce back , and sell shares gradually during rallies .

4759 On <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Thursday </TIMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William Fleckenstein </ENAMEX>, a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Seattle </ENAMEX>money <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">manager </ENAMEX>, used futures contracts in his personal account to place a bet that the broad market averages would decline .

5507 <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">David M . Jones </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">vice president </ENAMEX>at <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Aubrey G . Lanston &amp; Co . </ENAMEX>, recommends <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Treasury </ENAMEX>securities -LRB- of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">up to five years </TIMEX>' maturity -RRB- . 
5630 He says the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Oct . 6 </TIMEX>employment report , showing slower economic growth and a severe weakening in the manufacturing sector , is a warning sign to <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>. 
5785 <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">One </NUMEX>strategy for <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>who want to stay in but hedge their bets is to buy ` put ' options , either on the individual stocks they own or on a broad market index . 
5947 A put option gives its <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">holder </ENAMEX>the right -LRB- but not the obligation -RRB- to sell a stock -LRB- or stock index -RRB- for a specified price -LRB- the strike price -RRB- until the option expires . 
6114 Whether this insurance is worthwhile depends on the cost of an option . 
6185 The cost , or premium , tends to get fat in times of crisis . 
6244 Thus , buying puts after a big market slide can be an expensive way to hedge against risk . 
6336 The prices of puts generally did n't soar <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>. 
6385 For example , the premium as a percentage of the stock price for certain puts on <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Eli Lilly &amp; Co . </ENAMEX>moved up from <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">3 % </NUMEX>at <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Thursday </TIMEX>' s close to <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">only 3 . 3 % </NUMEX>at <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s close , even though the shares dropped <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">more than $ 5 . 50 </NUMEX>. 
6598 But put - option prices may zoom when trading resumes <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>. 
6659 It ' s hard to generalize about a reasonable price for puts . 
6718 But <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>should keep in mind , before paying too much , that the average <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:OTHER">annual </TIMEX>return for stock holdings , long - term , is <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">9 % to 10 % </NUMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">a year </TIMEX>; a return of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">15 % </NUMEX>is considered praiseworthy . 
6904 Paying , say , <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">10 % </NUMEX>for insurance against losses takes a deep bite out of the return . 
6989 <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">James A . White </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Tom Herman </ENAMEX>contributed to this article .  

9 Of all the <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>- time expenses incurred by a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">corporation </ENAMEX>or professional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firm </ENAMEX>, few are larger or longer term than the purchase of real estate or the signing of a commercial lease . 
189 To take full advantage of the financial opportunities in this commitment , however , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">corporation </ENAMEX>or professional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firm </ENAMEX>must do more than negotiate the best purchase price or lease terms . 
377 It must also evaluate the real - estate market in the chosen location from a new perspective . 
469 Specifically , it must understand how real - estate markets overreact to shifts in regional economies and then take advantage of these opportunities . 
618 When a regional economy catches <ENAMEX TYPE="DISEASE">cold </ENAMEX>, the local real - estate market gets <ENAMEX TYPE="DISEASE">pneumonia </ENAMEX>. 
701 In other words , real - estate market indicators , such as building permits and leasing activity , plummet much further than a local economy in recession . 
851 This was seen in the late <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1960s </TIMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Los Angeles </ENAMEX>and <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the mid - 1970s </TIMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York </ENAMEX>. 
929 But the reverse is also true : When a region ' s economy rebounds from a slowdown , these real - estate indicators will rebound far faster than the improving economy . 
1092 Why do local real - estate markets overreact to regional economic cycles ? 
1164 Because real - estate purchases and leases are such major long - term commitments that most <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">individuals </ENAMEX>make these decisions only when confident of future economic stability and growth . 
1362 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Metropolitan Detroit </ENAMEX>was written off economically during <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the early 1980s </TIMEX>, as the domestic auto industry suffered a serious sales depression and adjustment . 
1518 Area employment dropped by <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">13 % </NUMEX>from its <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1979 </TIMEX>peak and retail sales were down <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">14 % </NUMEX>. 
1600 However , the real - estate market was hurt even more . 
1652 For example , residential building permits in the trough year of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1982 </TIMEX>were off <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">76 % </NUMEX>from the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1979 </TIMEX>peak level . 
1762 Once metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Detroit </ENAMEX>' s economy rallied in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the mid - 1980s </TIMEX>, real estate rebounded . 
1847 Building permits , for example , soared a staggering <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">400 % </NUMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">between 1982 and the peak year of 1986 </TIMEX>. 
1945 Where , savvy <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">corporations </ENAMEX>and professional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firms </ENAMEX>are now asking , are <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>' s opportunities ? 
2039 Look no further than metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>, <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">two </NUMEX>of the most depressed , overbuilt and potentially undervalued real - estate markets in the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">nation </ENAMEX>. 
2193 Of course , some <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">observers </ENAMEX>have touted <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the past five years </TIMEX>as a counter - cyclical play . 
2302 But now appears to be the time to act . 
2343 Metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>' s economy did drop and then flatten in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the years </TIMEX>after its <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1982 </TIMEX>peak . 
2434 In <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the mid - 1980s </TIMEX>, employment was down <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">as much as 5 % </NUMEX>from the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1982 </TIMEX>peak and retail sales were off <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">13 % </NUMEX>. 
2538 The real - estate market suffered even more severe setbacks . 
2597 Office construction dropped <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">97 % </NUMEX>. 
2630 The vacancy rate soared <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">more than 20 % </NUMEX>in nearly every product category , and more than <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">30 % </NUMEX>of office space was vacant . 
2748 To some <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">observers </ENAMEX>, the empty office <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">buildings </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>' s ` see - through skyline ' were indicative of a very troubled economy . 
2875 As usual , the real - estate market had overreacted . 
2925 Actually , the region ' s economy retained a firm foundation . 
2984 Metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">population </ENAMEX>has held steady over <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the past six years </TIMEX>. 
3059 And personal income , after slumping in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the mid - 1980s </TIMEX>, has returned to its <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1982 </TIMEX>level in real dollar terms . 
3168 Today , metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>' s real - estate market is poised for a significant turnaround . 
3257 <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">More than 42 , 000 </NUMEX>jobs were added in metro <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">last year </TIMEX>, primarily in biotechnology , petrochemical processing , and the computer industry . 
3399 This growth puts <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>in the top <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">five </NUMEX>metro areas in the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:COUNTRY">nation </ENAMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">last year </TIMEX>. 
3477 And forecasts project a <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">2 . 5 % to 3 % </NUMEX>growth rate in jobs over <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the next few years </TIMEX>- - nearly twice the national average . 
3596 <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>is another metropolitan area where the commercial real - estate market has overreacted to the region ' s economic trends , although <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>has not experienced as severe an economic downturn as <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>. 
3800 By some measures , metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>' s economy has actually improved in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the past four years </TIMEX>. 
3894 Its <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">population </ENAMEX>has continued to increase since <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1983 </TIMEX>, <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the peak year </TIMEX>of the economic cycle . 
3984 Employment is now <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">4 % </NUMEX>higher than in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1983 </TIMEX>. 
4026 Buying income in real dollars actually increased <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">15 % </NUMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">between 1983 and 1987 </TIMEX>-LRB- <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the most recent year </TIMEX>available -RRB- . 
4137 The rates of increase , however , are less than the rapid growth of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the boom years </TIMEX>, and this has resulted in a loss of confidence in the economy . 
4281 In a self - fulfilling prophecy , therefore , the region ' s real - estate market all but collapsed in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">recent years </TIMEX>. 
4390 Housing building permits are down <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">more than 75 % </NUMEX>from their <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1983 </TIMEX>peaks . 
4463 Although no one can predict when metropolitan <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>' s real - estate market will rebound , major public works projects costing <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">several billion dollars </NUMEX>are under way or planned - - such as a new <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:BUILDING">convention center </ENAMEX>, a major <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:HIGHWAY_STREET">beltway </ENAMEX>encircling the metropolitan area , and a new regional <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:AIRPORT">airport </ENAMEX>. 
4750 When <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>' s regional economy begins to grow faster - - such a recovery could occur <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">as early as next year </TIMEX>- - business and consumer confidence will return , and the resulting explosion of real - estate activity will dwarf the general economic rebound . 
5000 What real - estate strategy should one follow in a metropolitan area whose economic health is not as easy to determine as <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Houston </ENAMEX>' s or <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>' s ? 
5143 Generally , overcapacity in commercial real estate is dropping from its <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">mid - 1980s </TIMEX>peak , even in such economically healthy metropolitan areas as <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Washington </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Los Angeles </ENAMEX>. 
5324 Vacancy rates in the <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">15 % to 19 % </NUMEX>range <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>may easily rise to the <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">low to mid - 20 % </NUMEX>range in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">a couple of years </TIMEX>. 
5434 Under these conditions , even a flattening out of economic growth - - ` catching <ENAMEX TYPE="DISEASE">cold </ENAMEX>' - - in the healthy metropolitan areas will create significant opportunities for <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">corporations </ENAMEX>and professional service <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firms </ENAMEX>looking for bargains as the realestate industry catches <ENAMEX TYPE="DISEASE">pneumonia </ENAMEX>. 
5710 Those looking for real - estate bargains in distressed metropolitan areas should lock in leases or buy now ; those looking in healthy metropolitan areas should take a short - term -LRB- <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">three - year </TIMEX>-RRB- lease and wait for the bargains ahead .

629 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">AGF </ENAMEX>did n't comment officially on its reasons for seeking the approval , but <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>close to the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">group </ENAMEX>said it was done to make sure the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">group </ENAMEX>would have the flexibility to increase its stake in the future , should interesting price opportunities arise .

9 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Apple Computer Inc . </ENAMEX>said it will offer cash rebates on several of its machines <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">from Oct . 14 to Dec . 31 </TIMEX>. , as part of a holiday - season sales promotion .

9 The economy ' s temperature will be taken from several vantage points <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">this week </TIMEX>, with readings on trade , output , housing and inflation .

563 That gain was being cited as a reason the stock market was down early in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s session , before it got started on its reckless <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">190 </NUMEX>- point plunge .

883 Meanwhile , <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">September </TIMEX>housing starts , due <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Wednesday </TIMEX>, are thought to have inched upward . 
972 ` There ' s a possibility of a surprise ' in the trade report , said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Michael Englund </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">director </ENAMEX>of research at <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MMS </ENAMEX>.

1251 In any event , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Englund </ENAMEX>and many others say that the easy gains in narrowing the trade gap have already been made . 
1368 ` Trade is definitely going to be more politically sensitive over <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the next six or seven months </TIMEX>as improvement begins to slow , ' he said . 
1505 Exports are thought to have risen strongly in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">August </TIMEX>, but probably not enough to offset the jump in imports , <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economists </ENAMEX>said . 
1633 Views on manufacturing strength are split between <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">economists </ENAMEX>who read <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">September </TIMEX>' s low level of factory job growth as a sign of a slowdown and those who use the somewhat more comforting total employment figures in their calculations . 
1866 The wide range of estimates for the industrial output number underscores the differences : The forecasts run from a drop of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">0 . 5 % </NUMEX>to an increase of <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">0 . 4 % </NUMEX>, according to <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MMS </ENAMEX>. 
2038 A rebound in energy prices , which helped push up the producer price index , is expected to do the same in the consumer price report .

9 For <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">20 years </TIMEX>, federal rules have barred the <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">three </NUMEX>major television <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>from sharing in one of the most lucrative and fastest - growing parts of the television business . 
181 And for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">six years </TIMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">ABC </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">CBS </ENAMEX>have negotiated with <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hollywood </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>in a futile attempt to change that . 
294 But with foreign <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>snapping up <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>movie <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>, the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>are pressing their fight harder than ever . 
409 They hope the foreign deals will divide the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hollywood </ENAMEX>opposition and prod <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Congress </ENAMEX>to push for ending federal rules that prohibit the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>from grabbing a piece of rerun sales and owning part of the shows they put on the air . 
641 Even <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">network </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">executives </ENAMEX>, however , admit privately that victory - - either in <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Congress </ENAMEX>or in talks with the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>- - is highly doubtful any time soon . 
792 And so the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>also are pushing for new ways to sidestep the ` fin - syn ' provisions , known formally as the Financial Interest and Syndication Rules . 
946 That became clear <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">last week </TIMEX>with the disclosure that <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">National Broadcasting Co . </ENAMEX>, backed by the deep pockets of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">parent </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">General Electric Co . </ENAMEX>, had tried to help fund <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Qintex Australia Ltd . </ENAMEX>' s now - scuttled <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 1 . 5 billion </NUMEX>bid for <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MGM \/ UA Communications Co .  
1193 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>' s interest may revive the deal , which <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MGM \/ UA </ENAMEX>killed <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">last week </TIMEX>when the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Australian </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">concern </ENAMEX>had trouble raising cash . 
1315 Even if that deal is n't revived , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>hopes to find another . 
1375 ` Our doors are open , ' an <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">spokesman </ENAMEX>says . 
1420 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>may yet find a way to take a passive , minority interest in a program - maker without violating the rules . 
1528 And any <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>effort could prompt <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">CBS Inc . </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">ABC </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">parent </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Capital Cities \/ ABC Inc . </ENAMEX>, to look for ways of skirting the fin - syn regulations . 
1668 But the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>' push may only aggravate an increasingly bitter rift between them and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hollywood </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>. 
1774 Both sides are to sit down <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">next month </TIMEX>for yet another meeting on how they might agree on reducing fin - syn restraints . 
1892 Few <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>privy to the talks expect the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>to budge . 
1953 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>still are ` uninhibited in their authority ' over what shows get on the air , charges <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:OTHER">Motion Picture Association </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">President </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jack Valenti </ENAMEX>, the most vociferous opponent of rescinding the rules . 
2154 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">Studios </ENAMEX>are ` powerless ' to get shows in prime - time lineups and keep them there long enough to go into lucrative rerun sales , he contends . 
2292 And that ' s why the rules , for the most part , must stay in place , he says . 
2368 Studio <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">executives </ENAMEX>in on the talks - including <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>at <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Paramount Communications Inc . </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Fries Entertainment Inc . </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Warner Communications Inc . </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MCA Inc . </ENAMEX>- - declined to be interviewed .

2943 That ' s the problem , is n't it ? '

' 
4422 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">Big Three </ENAMEX>' s drumbeat for deregulation began intensifying in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the summer </TIMEX>when the former <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Time Inc . </ENAMEX>went ahead with plans to acquire <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Warner </ENAMEX>. 
4564 Although <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Time </ENAMEX>already had a long - term contract to buy movies from <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Warner </ENAMEX>, the merger will let <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Time </ENAMEX>' s largely unregulated pay - cable <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">channel </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Home Box Office </ENAMEX>, own the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Warner </ENAMEX>movies aired on <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">HBO </ENAMEX>- - a vertical integration that is effectively blocked by fin - syn regulations . 
4836 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>' s Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Wright </ENAMEX>led the way in decrying the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>' inability to match a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Time - Warner </ENAMEX>combination . 
4937 He spoke up again when the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Sony </ENAMEX>bid for <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Columbia </ENAMEX>was announced . 
5001 Since <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>' s interest in the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Qintex </ENAMEX>bid for <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MGM \/ UA </ENAMEX>was disclosed , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Wright </ENAMEX>has n't been available for comment . 
5112 With a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Qintex </ENAMEX>deal , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>would move into uncharted territory - - possibly raising hackles at the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>and in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Washington </ENAMEX>. 
5236 ` It ' s never really been tested , ' says <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William Lilley III </ENAMEX>, who as a top <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">CBS </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">executive </ENAMEX>spent <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">years </TIMEX>lobbying to have the rules lifted . 
5368 He now runs <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Policy Communications </ENAMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Washington </ENAMEX>, consulting to media <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>. 
5448 Fin - syn rules do n't explicitly block a network from buying a passive , small stake in a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>that profits from the rerun syndication <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>ca n't enjoy . 
5607 Hence , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">NBC </ENAMEX>might be able to take , say , a <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">5 % </NUMEX>stake in a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>such as <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">MGM \/ UA </ENAMEX>. 
5686 If the transaction raised objections , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studio </ENAMEX>' s syndication <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">operations </ENAMEX>could be spun off into a separate <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firm </ENAMEX>in which the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">network </ENAMEX>does n't have a direct stake . 
5851 But such convolutions would still block the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>from grabbing a big chunk of the riches of syndication . 
5960 Under current rules , even when a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">network </ENAMEX>fares well with a <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">100 % </NUMEX>- owned series - - <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">ABC </ENAMEX>, for example , made a killing in broadcasting its popular crime \/ comedy ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Moonlighting </ENAMEX>' - - it is n't allowed to share in the continuing proceeds when the reruns are sold to local <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">stations </ENAMEX>. 
6229 Instead , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">ABC </ENAMEX>will have to sell off the rights for a <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>- time fee . 
6297 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>admit that the chances of getting the relief they want are slim - - for <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">several years </TIMEX>at the least . 
6411 <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Six years ago </TIMEX>they were tantalizingly close . 
6456 The <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Reagan </ENAMEX>- era <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Federal Communications Commission </ENAMEX>had ruled in favor of killing most of the rules . 
6554 Various evidence , including a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:EDUCATIONAL">Brookings Institution </ENAMEX>study of <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">some 800 </NUMEX>series that the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>had aired and had partly owned in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the 1960s </TIMEX>, showed the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>did n't wield undue control over the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>as had been alleged . 
6781 But <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">just eight days </TIMEX>before the rules were to die , former <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">President </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Ronald Reagan </ENAMEX>, a <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>- time <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">actor </ENAMEX>, intervened on behalf of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hollywood </ENAMEX>. 
6916 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">FCC </ENAMEX>effort collapsed . 
6944 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>have bickered ever since . 
6995 Network <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>involved in the studio talks may hope the foreign influx builds more support in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Washington </ENAMEX>, but that seems unlikely . 
7130 In <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Congress </ENAMEX>, the issue falters : It ' s about money , not program quality , and <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Hollywood </ENAMEX>has lots of clout given its fund raising for <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">senators </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">representatives </ENAMEX>overseeing the issue . 
7313 A <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">spokesman </ENAMEX>for <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Rep . </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Edward J . Markey </ENAMEX>-LRB- <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:POLITICAL">D </ENAMEX>- <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Mass . </ENAMEX>-RRB- , who heads a <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">subcommittee </ENAMEX>that oversees the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">FCC </ENAMEX>, says Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Markey </ENAMEX>feels ` the world has been forever changed by the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Sony </ENAMEX>- <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Columbia </ENAMEX>deal . ' 
7496 But he said Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Markey </ENAMEX>hopes this pushes the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">networks </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">studios </ENAMEX>to work it out on their own .

Sikes </ENAMEX>has said he wants the <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">two </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">sides </ENAMEX>to hammer out their own plan .

1499 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Financial Corp . </ENAMEX>purchased the bonds in <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">at least 70 </NUMEX>different transactions in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1984 </TIMEX>and since then has realized <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 11 million </NUMEX>in losses on them , the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>said .  

9 reminiscent of those during the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash - - that as stock prices plummeted and trading activity escalated , some phone calls to market <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">makers </ENAMEX>in over - the - counter stocks went unanswered .

340 ` It was -LCB- like -RCB- the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>before <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:OTHER">Black Monday </ENAMEX>' <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">two years ago </TIMEX>.

2645 Market <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">makers </ENAMEX>keep supplies of stock on hand to maintain orderly trading when imbalances occur . 
2741 On <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">days </TIMEX>like <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>, that means they must buy shares from <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">sellers </ENAMEX>when no one else is willing to . 
2839 When selling is so frenzied , prices fall steeply and fast . 
2898 <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Two years ago </TIMEX>, faced with the possibility of heavy losses on the stocks in their inventories , market <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">makers </ENAMEX>themselves began dumping shares , exacerbating the slide in OTC stock prices . 
3085 On <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>, some market <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">makers </ENAMEX>were selling again , <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">traders </ENAMEX>said . 
3149 But , with profits sagging on Wall Street since the crash , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>have kept smaller share stockpiles on hand . 
3263 Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Tarantino </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Hambrecht &amp; Quist </ENAMEX>said some prices fell without trades taking place , as market <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">makers </ENAMEX>kept dropping the prices at which they would buy shares . 
3423 ` Everyone was hitting everyone else ' s bid , ' he said . 
3478 So , while OTC <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>incurred losses on <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>, trading <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">officials </ENAMEX>said the damage was n't as bad as it was in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>. 
3596 ` <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Two years ago </TIMEX>we were carrying huge inventories and that was the big culprit .

' 
4215 ` The pace of trading was orderly , ' he said .

4510 In the past , the OTC market thrived on a firm base of small - investor participation .

9 Of all the ethnic tensions in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">America </ENAMEX>, which is the most troublesome right now ? 
89 A good bet would be the tension between <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">blacks </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jews </ENAMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York City </ENAMEX>. 
163 Or so it must seem to <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie Mason </ENAMEX>, the veteran <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">comedian </ENAMEX>appearing in a new <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">ABC </ENAMEX>sitcom airing on <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Tuesday </TIMEX><TIMEX TYPE="TIME">nights </TIMEX>-LRB- <TIMEX TYPE="TIME">9 : 30 - 10 p . m . EDT </TIMEX>-RRB- . 
302 Not only is Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">star </ENAMEX>of ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Chicken Soup </ENAMEX>, ' he ' s also the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">inheritor </ENAMEX>of a comedic tradition dating back to ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Duck Soup </ENAMEX>, ' and he ' s currently a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">man </ENAMEX>in hot water . 
468 Here , in neutral language , is the gist of Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s remarks , quoted <NUMEX TYPE="ORDINAL">first </NUMEX>in the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Village Voice </ENAMEX>while he was a paid <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">spokesman </ENAMEX>for the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Rudolph Giuliani </ENAMEX>mayoral campaign , and then in <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Newsweek </ENAMEX>after he and the campaign parted company . 
701 Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>said that many <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">voters </ENAMEX>feel guilty toward <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">blacks </ENAMEX>, so they support black <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">candidates </ENAMEX>uncritically . 
814 He said that many black <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">voters </ENAMEX>feel bitter about racial discrimination , so they , too , support black <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">candidates </ENAMEX>uncritically . 
939 He said that <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jews </ENAMEX>have contributed more to black causes over <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">the years </TIMEX>than vice versa . 
1029 Of course , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>did not use neutral language . 
1080 As a practitioner of ethnic humor from <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the old days </TIMEX>on the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCATION:REGION">Borscht Belt </ENAMEX>, live television and the nightclub circuit , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>instinctively reached for the vernacular . 
1248 He said <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jews </ENAMEX>were ` sick with complexes ' ; and he called <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">David Dinkins </ENAMEX>, Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Giuliani </ENAMEX>' s black <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">opponent </ENAMEX>, ` a fancy <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">shvartze </ENAMEX>with a mustache . ' 
1387 If Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>had used less derogatory language to articulate his amateur analysis of the voting behavior of his fellow <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">New Yorkers </ENAMEX>, would the water be quite so hot ? 
1552 It probably would , because few or none of the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>upset by Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s remarks have bothered to distinguish between the substance of his comments and the fact that he used insulting language . 
1747 In addition , some of Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">critics </ENAMEX>have implied that his type of ethnic humor is itself a form of racism . 
1861 For example , the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York </ENAMEX>state <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">counsel </ENAMEX>for the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:OTHER">NAACP </ENAMEX>said that Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>is ` like a <ENAMEX TYPE="ANIMAL">dinosaur </ENAMEX>. 
1956 <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">People </ENAMEX>are fast leaving the place where he is stuck . ' 
2012 These <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">critics </ENAMEX>fail to distinguish between the type of ethnic humor that aims at disparaging another <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:OTHER">group </ENAMEX>, such as ` <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Polish </ENAMEX>jokes ' ; and the type that is double - edged , aiming inward as well as outward . 
2212 The latter typically is the humor of the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">underdog </ENAMEX>, and it was perfected by both <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">blacks </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jews </ENAMEX>on the minstrel and vaudeville stage as a means of mocking their white and gentile <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">audiences </ENAMEX>along with themselves . 
2426 In the hands of a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">zealot </ENAMEX>like <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lenny Bruce </ENAMEX>, this double - edged blade could cut both the self and the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">audience </ENAMEX>to ribbons . 
2546 But wielded by a pro like <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie Mason </ENAMEX>, it is a constructive form of mischief . 
2625 Why constructive ? 
2643 Because despite all the media prattle about comedy and politics not mixing , they are similar in <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>respect : Both can serve as mechanisms for easing tensions and facilitating the co - existence of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:OTHER">groups </ENAMEX>in conflict . 
2858 That ' s why it ' s dangerous to have well - intentioned thought <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">police </ENAMEX>, on college <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC_DESC:OTHER">campuses </ENAMEX>and elsewhere , taboo all critical mention of group differences . 
3011 As <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Elizabeth Kristol </ENAMEX>wrote in the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">New York Times </ENAMEX>just before the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>donnybrook , ` Perhaps intolerance would not boil over with such intensity if honest differences were allowed to simmer . ' 
3202 The question is , if group conflicts still exist -LRB- as undeniably they do -RRB- , and if Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s type of ethnic humor is passe , then what other means do we have for letting off steam ? 
3383 Do n't say the TV sitcom , because that happens to be a genre that , in its desperate need to attract everybody and offend nobody , resembles politics more than it does comedy . 
3556 It is true that the best sitcoms do allow group differences to simmer : <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">yuppies </ENAMEX>vs . blue - collar <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Bostonians </ENAMEX>in ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Cheers </ENAMEX>' ; <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">children </ENAMEX>vs . <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">adults </ENAMEX>in ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">The Cosby Show </ENAMEX>. ' 
3716 But these are not the differences that make headlines . 
3773 In ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Chicken Soup </ENAMEX>, ' Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>plays <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie </ENAMEX>, a <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">bachelor </ENAMEX>courting <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Maddie </ENAMEX>-LRB- <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Lynn Redgrave </ENAMEX>-RRB- , an <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Irish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">widow </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">mother </ENAMEX>of <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">three </NUMEX>, against the wishes of his <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">mother </ENAMEX>-LRB- <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Rita Karin </ENAMEX>-RRB- and her <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">brother </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Michael </ENAMEX>-LRB- <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Brandon Maggart </ENAMEX>-RRB- . 
3992 It ' s worth noting that both disapproving <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">relatives </ENAMEX>are <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">immigrants </ENAMEX>. 
4059 At least , they both speak with strong accents , as do <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Maddie </ENAMEX>. 
4131 It could n't be more obvious that ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Chicken Soup </ENAMEX>' is being made from an old recipe . 
4213 And a safe one - - imagine if the romance in question were between an <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Orthodox Jew </ENAMEX>and a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">member </ENAMEX>of the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Nation of Islam </ENAMEX>. 
4334 Back in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the 1920s </TIMEX>, the play and movie versions of ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Abie ' s Irish Rose </ENAMEX>' made the theme of courtship between the assimilated offspring of <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Irish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">immigrants </ENAMEX>so popular that its <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">author </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Anne Nichols </ENAMEX>, lost a plagiarism suit on the grounds that the plot has entered the public domain . 
4622 And it has remained there , as evidenced by its reappearance in a <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1972 </TIMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">CBS </ENAMEX>sitcom called ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Bridget Loves Bernie </ENAMEX>, ' whose sole distinction was that it led to the real - life marriage of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Meredith Baxter </ENAMEX>and <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">David Birney </ENAMEX>. 
4838 Clearly , the question with ` <ENAMEX TYPE="WORK_OF_ART:OTHER">Chicken Soup </ENAMEX>' is not whether the pot will boil over , but whether it will simmer at all . 
4954 So far , the bubbles have been few and far between . 
5005 Part of the problem is the tendency of all sitcoms , ever since <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the didactic days </TIMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Norman Lear </ENAMEX>, to preach about social issues . 
5133 To some extent , this tendency emerges whenever the show tries to enlighten us about ethnic stereotypes by reversing them . 
5257 For instance , <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Michael </ENAMEX>dislikes <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie </ENAMEX>not because he ' s a shrewd <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">businessman </ENAMEX>, but because he quits his well - paying job as a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">salesman </ENAMEX>in order to become a social <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">worker </ENAMEX>. 
5432 Even more problematic is the incompatibility between sitcom preachiness and Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s comic persona . 
5535 The best moments in the show occur at the beginning and the end -LRB- and occasionally in the middle -RRB- , when Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>slips into his standup mode and starts meting out that old - fashioned <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX>mischief to other <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>as well as to himself . 
5772 But too often , these routines lack spark because this sitcom , like all sitcoms , is timid about confronting Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>' s stock in trade - ethnic differences . 
5928 I ' m not suggesting that the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">producers </ENAMEX>start putting together episodes about topics like the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Catholic </ENAMEX>- <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Jewish </ENAMEX>dispute over the <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:RELIGION">Carmelite </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:RELIGIOUS">convent </ENAMEX>at <ENAMEX TYPE="FAC:OTHER">Auschwitz </ENAMEX>. 
6085 That issue , like racial tensions in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York City </ENAMEX>, will have to cool down , not heat up , before it can simmer . 
6195 But I am suggesting that they stop requiring Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Mason </ENAMEX>to interrupt his classic shtik with some line about ` caring for other <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">people </ENAMEX>' that would sound shmaltzy on the lips of <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Miss America </ENAMEX>. 
6383 At your age , <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Jackie </ENAMEX>, you ought to know that you ca n't make soup without turning up the flame .

3359 ` That is a miracle . '

3606 In fact , some of the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">network </ENAMEX>' s <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Hungarian </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">listeners </ENAMEX>say they owe <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Radio Free Europe </ENAMEX>loyalty because it was responsible in many ways for keeping hope alive through what <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">writer </ENAMEX>here calls the ` <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Dark Ages of the 20th Century </TIMEX>. ' 
3833 ` During <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">the past four years </TIMEX>, many of us have sat up until late at <TIMEX TYPE="TIME">night </TIMEX>listening to our radios , ' says the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">writer </ENAMEX>. 
3948 ` There were some very brave broadcasts . ' 
3991 The <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">listeners </ENAMEX>, too , had to be brave . 
4028 Through much of the post - <ENAMEX TYPE="EVENT:WAR">World War II </ENAMEX>period , listening to Western broadcasts was a crime in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Hungary </ENAMEX>. 
4130 ` When we listen to the <ENAMEX TYPE="LOCATION:CONTINENT">Europe </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">station </ENAMEX>, my <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">mother </ENAMEX>still gets nervous , ' says a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Budapest </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">translator </ENAMEX>.
