9 Pension funds , <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">insurers </ENAMEX>and other <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">behemoths </ENAMEX>of the investing world said they began scooping up stocks during <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s market rout . 
140 And they plan to buy more <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>. 
175 Rightly or wrongly , many giant institutional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">investors </ENAMEX>appear to be fighting the latest war by applying the lesson they learned in the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">October 1987 </TIMEX>crash : Buying at the bottom pays off . 
363 To be sure , big <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">investors </ENAMEX>might put away their checkbooks in a hurry if stocks open sharply lower <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">today </TIMEX>. 
468 They could still panic and bail out of the market . 
519 But their <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>performance indicates that they wo n't abandon stocks unless conditions get far worse . 
622 ` Last time , we got rewarded for going out and buying stocks when the panic was the worst , ' said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">John W . Rogers </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">president </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Chicago </ENAMEX>- based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Ariel Capital Management Inc . </ENAMEX>, which manages <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 1 . 1 billion </NUMEX>of stocks . 
832 Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Rogers </ENAMEX>spent half his cash on hand <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>for ` our favorite stocks that have fallen apart . ' 
928 He expects to invest the rest if the market weakens further . 
991 <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Denver </ENAMEX>- based portfolio <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">manager </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">James Craig </ENAMEX>was n't daunted when <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s rout shaved <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 40 million </NUMEX>from the value of the <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 752 million </NUMEX>Janus Fund he oversees . 
1146 ` I waited to make sure all the program trades had kicked through , ' he said . 
1222 Then he jumped into the market : 
1254 ` I spent <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 30 million </NUMEX>in <TIMEX TYPE="TIME">the last half - hour </TIMEX>. ' 
1301 Other money <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">managers </ENAMEX>also opened their wallets . 
1349 ` I was buying at the close -LRB- <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>-RRB- and I ' ll be buying again because I know we ' re getting good value , ' said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Frederick A . Moran </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">president </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Moran Asset Management Inc . </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Greenwich </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Conn .  
1536 ` There is no justification on the fundamental level for this crash . ' 
1607 Unlike mutual funds , which can be forced to sell stockholdings when <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>rush to withdraw money , big <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">investors </ENAMEX>such as pension funds and insurance <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">companies </ENAMEX>can decide to ride out market storms without jettisoning stock . 
1833 Most often , they do just that , because stocks have proved to be the best - performing long - term investment , attracting <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">about $ 1 trillion </NUMEX>from pension funds alone . 
1996 ` If you bought after the crash , you did very very well off the bottom , ' said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Stephen B . Timbers </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">chief investment officer </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Chicago </ENAMEX>- based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Kemper Financial Services Inc .  
2166 The <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 56 billion </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">California Public Employees Retirement System </ENAMEX>, for <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>, added <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 1 billion </NUMEX>to its stock portfolio <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">two years ago </TIMEX>. 
2295 ` The last crash taught institutional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">investors </ENAMEX>that they have to be long - term <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">holders </ENAMEX>, and that they ca n't react to short - term events , good or bad , ' said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Stephen L . Nesbitt </ENAMEX>, senior <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">vice president </ENAMEX>for the pension <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">consultants </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Wilshire Associates </ENAMEX>in <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">Santa Monica </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Calif .  
2563 ` Those that pulled out -LRB- of stocks -RRB- regretted it , ' he said , ` so I doubt you ' ll see any significant changes ' in institutional portfolios as a result of <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s decline . 
2733 Stocks , as measured by the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Standard &amp; Poor </ENAMEX>' s <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">500 </NUMEX>- stock index , have been stellar performers <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">this year </TIMEX>, rising <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">27 . 97 % </NUMEX>before <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s plunge , excluding dividends . 
2894 Even <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s slump leaves <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">investors </ENAMEX>ahead <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">more than 20 % </NUMEX>, well above the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:OTHER">annual </TIMEX>average for stocks over <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">several decades </TIMEX>. 
3017 ` You could go down <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">400 </NUMEX>points and still have <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">a good year </TIMEX>in the market , ' said <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">James D . Awad </ENAMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">president </ENAMEX>of <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York </ENAMEX>- based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">BMI Capital Corp .

3256 It can happen before you can turn around . ' 
3299 He said he discerns many parallels with <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>, including the emphasis on takeover stocks and the re - emergence of computerized program trading . 
3441 ` The only thing you do n't have , ' he said , ` is the ` portfolio insurance ' phenomenon overlaid on the rest . ' 
3549 Most institutional <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">investors </ENAMEX>have abandoned the portfolio insurance hedging technique , which is widely thought to have worsened the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash . 
3693 Not really insurance , this tactic was designed to soften the blow of declining stock prices and generate an offsetting profit by selling waves of <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">S &amp; P </ENAMEX>futures contracts . 
3862 In its severest test , the <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 60 billion </NUMEX>of portfolio insurance in effect in the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1987 </TIMEX>crash did n't work , as stock <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">buyers </ENAMEX>disappeared and stock and futures prices became disconnected . 
4044 Even without portfolio insurance , market conditions were grim <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>, money <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">managers </ENAMEX>said . 
4135 <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Neil Weisman </ENAMEX>, whose <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:CITY">New York </ENAMEX>- based <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Chilmark Capital Partners </ENAMEX>had converted <NUMEX TYPE="PERCENT">85 % </NUMEX>of its <NUMEX TYPE="MONEY">$ 220 million </NUMEX>investment pool to cash in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">recent months </TIMEX>, said he was besieged by Wall Street <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">firms </ENAMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>asking him to take stock off their hands .

1475 <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">Justin </ENAMEX>' s plight shows what can happen when a tiny <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>suddenly faces the full legal might of a wrathful <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">multinational </ENAMEX>. 
1600 With considerable irony , the case also shows how completely <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Japan </ENAMEX>has turned the tables on <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX>business . 
1706 <ENAMEX TYPE="NORP:NATIONALITY">Americans </ENAMEX>used to complain bitterly about being undersold by look - alike products from <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">Japan </ENAMEX>.

2534 <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Today </TIMEX>, <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:COUNTRY">U . S . </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Judge </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">John E . 3293 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:CORPORATION">company </ENAMEX>has grown - - to <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">about 40 </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">employees </ENAMEX>, from <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">four </NUMEX>initially , Mr . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Kaye </ENAMEX>says .

'

9 The <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Bush </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>, urging the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Supreme Court </ENAMEX>to give states more leeway to restrict abortions , said <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">minors </ENAMEX>have n't any right to abortion without the consent of their <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">parents </ENAMEX>. 
191 <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Solicitor General </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Kenneth Starr </ENAMEX>argued that the <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1973 </TIMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Supreme Court </ENAMEX>decision , <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Roe </ENAMEX>vs . <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Wade </ENAMEX>, recognizing a constitutional right to abortion , was incorrect . 
345 He also argued that the high <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">court </ENAMEX>was wrong in <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1976 </TIMEX>to rule that <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">minors </ENAMEX>have a right to abortion that ca n't be absolutely vetoed by their <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">parents </ENAMEX>. 
495 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>' s position was outlined in a friend - of - the - court brief filed in <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">one </NUMEX>of <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">three </NUMEX>abortion cases the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Supreme Court </ENAMEX>will hear argued and will decide this term . 
668 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>filed the brief in an appeal involving a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Minnesota </ENAMEX>law that requires that both <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">parents </ENAMEX>of a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">minor </ENAMEX>be notified before she may have an abortion . 
832 The <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>urged the <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">justices </ENAMEX>to adopt a legal standard suggested by <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">Chief Justice </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">William Rehnquist </ENAMEX><TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">last July </TIMEX>when the high <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">court </ENAMEX>upheld <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Missouri </ENAMEX>' s abortion restrictions . 
1012 Under that standard , which garnered the votes of <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">only three </NUMEX>of the <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">nine </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">justices </ENAMEX>, a state restriction of abortion is constitutional if the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:STATE_PROVINCE">state </ENAMEX>has a ` reasonable ' justification for adopting it . 
1207 That is a much easier standard for a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:STATE_PROVINCE">state </ENAMEX>to satisfy than the <ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:GOVERNMENT">Supreme Court </ENAMEX>' s test since <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">1973 </TIMEX>, which requires a <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE_DESC:STATE_PROVINCE">state </ENAMEX>to have a ` compelling ' reason for restricting abortion . 
1384 On the provisions of the <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Minnesota </ENAMEX>law , the <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Bush </ENAMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">administration </ENAMEX>said that requiring that both <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">parents </ENAMEX>be notified is a reasonable regulation , and that there is no need to have an alternative that allows <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">minors </ENAMEX>to go to <ENAMEX TYPE="ORG_DESC:GOVERNMENT">court </ENAMEX>for a <ENAMEX TYPE="PER_DESC">judge </ENAMEX>' s permission instead . 
1645 The case , <ENAMEX TYPE="PERSON">Hodgson </ENAMEX>vs . <ENAMEX TYPE="GPE:STATE_PROVINCE">Minnesota </ENAMEX>, will be argued <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Nov . 29 </TIMEX>.  

9 Plunge ? 
17 What plunge ? 
32 <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">Twenty - four </NUMEX><ENAMEX TYPE="ORGANIZATION:CORPORATION">New York Stock Exchange </ENAMEX>issues hit <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DURATION">52 - week </TIMEX>highs during <TIMEX TYPE="DATE:DATE">Friday </TIMEX>' s trading , despite the Dow Jones Industrial Average ' s <NUMEX TYPE="CARDINAL">190 . 58 </NUMEX>- point plunge .
